metadata.title: CVE-2021-47565 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:mpt3sas: Fix kernel panic during drive powercycle test While looping overshost's sdev list it is possible that one of the drives is getting removedand its sas_target object is freed but its sdev object remains intact.Consequently, a kernel panic can occur while the driver is trying to accessthe sas_address field of sas_target object without also checking thesas_target object for NULL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1120-aws - 4.15.0-1120.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-gcp - 4.15.0-1116.130~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1087-oracle - 4.15.0-1087.95~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
